intro: Senecio dewevrei, commonly known as the Dewevre's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Senecio dewevrei is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
